RA1.name: Locally provisioned services with an impact on the health of citizens (e.g., waste disposal)

businessImpact.name: Very High
businessImpact.description: Catastrophic disruption or compromise of a number of Local Authority services, or catastrophic faults within these services which could lead to severe health risks and widespread loss of life [e.g., cyber-attacks on power and water supplies, vaccine distribution and transport links]

businessImpact.name: High
businessImpact.description: An event leading to major disruption or compromise of local authority services, or critical faults within these services, which could result in severe health risks and limited loss of life. [e.g., the 1998 Camelford incident when 20k tonnes of aluminium sulphate was dumped in the water supply].

businessImpact.name: Medium
businessImpact.description: A more serious action causing significant authority-wide disruption, compromise or flawed working of services which could lead to major health risks to numerous people in the region of 10s, 100s or even 1,000s.

businessImpact.name: Low
businessImpact.description: An event impacting a larger community such as an authority-wide disruption, compromise or flawed working of services which could impose an increased risk to health and wellbeing.

businessImpact.name: Very Low
businessImpact.description: An event that leads to disruption, compromise or flawed working of local services which could pose a risk to community health [ e.g., spread of disease caused by a breakdown in refuse collection, sewage disposal, water treatment or vaccination programme]

riskAppetite.name: Eager
riskAppetite.description: Eagerness, focus  or requirement to be innovative, designed to maximise opportunity.  Approach in pursuit of very high reward but may carry very high residual risk.

riskAppetite.name: Open
riskAppetite.description: Aim to undertake activities that have a high degree of purpose  value, where the likeliness of success being a determining factor. Activity may carry a large amount of residual risk.

riskAppetite.name: Cautious
riskAppetite.description: Willingness to accept a degree of risk in order to achieve key purpose e.g.  Inherent risk is deemed controllable or acceptable to a large extent.

riskAppetite.name: Minimalist
riskAppetite.description:
Tendency to undertake activities that are considered safe in achieving objects.
Pursuit of opportunity is not a key driver where inherent risk is above low.

riskAppetite.name: Averse
riskAppetite.description: Avoidance of risk in achievement of key objectives is paramount.  Activities only considered when carrying little low or very low (rare) Residual risk.

RA2.name: Locally provisioned services with no impact on health or safety of citizens (e.g., library services, land use and planning services).

businessImpact.name: Very High
businessImpact.description: A widespread action resulting in a total loss of major services provided by a number of local authorities throughout a region or country leading to severe financial losses and major lasting economic damage across the country.

businessImpact.name: High
businessImpact.description: A serious event culminating in a total loss of major services provided by a local authority, leading to severe financial losses to the authority and/or devastating losses to numerous members of the public [e.g., the recent cyberattack that closed down Gloucestershire Council’s online revenue and benefits sections, planning and customer services.]

businessImpact.name: Medium
businessImpact.description: An activity resulting a loss of major services provided by local authorities leading to major financial problems for the authority and/or citizens [e.g., the shutdown of financial services causing an inability to collect or pay monies; a close of schools and nurseries leading to widespread childcare problems etc]

businessImpact.name: Low
businessImpact.description: An event leading to the cancellation of multiple services to a number (up to 1,000) of citizens resulting in significant and individual financial losses. [e.g., an attack on payroll services, disruption to finance departments so they can’t pay invoices and/or transport links leading to route closures etc.

businessImpact.name: Very Low
businessImpact.description: Any activity resulting in the cancellation of services to up to 100 people [e.g., closure of a local library, sporting centre, community hall or other facility.

RA3.name: Locally provisioned services in support of the Civil Contingencies Act

businessImpact.name: Very High
businessImpact.description: An action that prevents several local or national authorities from responding to a major incident within 12 although it affects a large number of citizens / local businesses [ e.g., major flooding, fire, contamination, explosion or CNI failure.]

businessImpact.name: High
businessImpact.description: An event which causes a major incident to which a local authority cannot react within 12 hours, but which affects a large number of citizens / local businesses - e.g., major flooding, fire, contamination, explosion or CNI failure

businessImpact.name: Medium
businessImpact.description: A large major incident to which a local authority is unable to react within 24 hours even though it affects a large number of citizens / local businesses [e.g., major flooding, fire, contamination, explosion or CNI failure].

businessImpact.name: Low
businessImpact.description: An incident classed as significant, meaning a local authority is unable to react within 24 despite it impacting a large number of people / local businesses [e.g., flooding, fire, chemical incident leading to contamination or an explosion of some kind]

businessImpact.name: Very Low
businessImpact.description: An action resulting in a minor isolated incident to which a local authority is unable to react within a few days but that has an impact on a number of citizens / local businesses. [e.g., short-term interruption of power or mains water supplies
